thread.title: Hacked Investment Advisor Fined $75,000 for Lack of Cyber-Security Measures
thread.title_full: Hacked Investment Advisor Fined $75,000 for Lack of Cyber-Security Measures

author: Armstrong Teasdale LLP
title: Hacked Investment Advisor Fined $75,000 for Lack of Cyber-Security Measures
text:
Hacked Investment Advisor Fined $75,000 for Lack of Cyber-Security Measures more+ Contact 
To embed, copy and paste the code into your website or blog: <iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=59a21cfc-84f6-477d-9222-1ee5f1d3b58a" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"></iframe> 
Many in the investment advisory community are following the story of R.T. Jones Capital Equities Management, an investment advisor that, according to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), suffered a hack exposing the personally identifiable information of "approximately 100,000 individuals, including thousands of the firm’s clients." • Advisor’ • • Advisor’s agreement to cease and desist from violations of Rule 30(a) of Regulation S-P. "The firm failed entirely to adopt written policies and procedures reasonably designed to safeguard customer information. • R.T. Jones "failed to conduct periodic risk assessments…or maintain a response plan for cybersecurity incidents. *SEC Press Release, found at http://www.sec.gov/news/pressrelease/2015-202.html
